1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Nanna Vee lives in a trailer with overweight husband Tony and grandson Eron, whose mother is in prison. She also runs a dog training class through which she meets the handsome widower Alexander, whose Labradoodle Toffee has a habit of eating other dogs' messes. FuturZ social worker Naomi Singh visits to see about administering a grant for Eron and Nanna suggests she enrol Charlie, the badly-behaved Labrador Naomi has bought her spoilt daughter Jasmine. Naomi also takes a shine to Alexander, leading to a rivalry in which Naomi accuses Nanna of robbing her and ...

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Naomi gets an on the spot fine when Charlie slips his lead and chases Gerald, the ginger cat belonging to eccentric Heaven Jones and when Gerald disappears Naomi is threatened with prosecution. Sympathetic Chief Superintendent Gerry Hooper - actually Nanna's bit on the side - quashes the fine and suggests Naomi bring Charlie to a dog's obedience day being run by Nanna. Charlie misbehaves again and Naomi is set on by Heaven, who turns out to be Gerry's estranged wife. With Gerald the cat reappearing there is romance in the air as Gerry and Heaven reunite and Jasmine ...

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Whilst Naomi practises for the West Kirby sailing club races Nana has a serious cash flow problem and is grateful to Naomi for paying Tony to do her paperwork though Nana's attempt to sell underwear is a non-starter. Having entrusted the dog-walking to Jasmine and Eron Nana invites herself to Naomi's dinner party but gets a panic call as the kids and the dogs have been cut off by the tide requiring Nana and the sailing club to rescue them.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Naomi welcomes Jepherson 'Jep' Denomer, FutureZ's trustee, to look at projects in the area , which includes a trip to Nana's, to see Eron in his football boots. Jep hits it off with Nana, giving her financial tips, but has to travel again and leaves his very elderly dog Tuggy with Naomi. Tuggy falls ill and the vet proposes putting him down and Naomi and Nana form a bond as they wait together for Jep's decision. However, after Tuggy has been put to sleep the bond is tested when Jasmine announces that she is pregnant by Eron.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Nana's reprobate brother Fatdraic arrives for Eron's birthday. He is loud and boorish but he does charm Naomi, who gets drunk on learning that her husband has left her for another man, and they have sex together . Eron is due to visit his mother - who has changed her name from Barbara to Percy - in prison , accompanied by Jasmine, who has baked some cakes for her. Nana, Naomi and Fatdraic go along with them but Fatdraic leaves in a hurry and Nana realizes he has spiked the cakes with dope. To prevent discovery she and Naomi eat them and get very high.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: The fire prevention officer's visit to Nana's caravan unfortunately coincides with Jasmine setting the kitchen alight but, despite bad news from the prison and her dog No-Name having pups, Nana helps Naomi, who has lost Charlie and, unable to contact her husband, is struggling to pay the Polish workmen. Then the caravan burns down but Tony heroically saves the puppies from the blaze and, as a thank you for her help with Charlie, Naomi provides the family with a new residential camper van.

imdb.plot outline: Written by and starring Jo Scanlan and Vicki Pepperdine, co-creators of the BAFTA nominated Getting On, Puppy Love is a story of love, dogs and the love of dogs. Set around The Wirral-based dog training classes run by the formidable Nana V (Jo Scanlan) - "For All Your Dogging Needs". Puppy Love follows two very different women - Nana V and Naomi Singh (Vicki Pepperdine) as they navigate their headstrong dogs, impossible teenage kids and disappointing husbands.
imdb.title: Puppy Love
plot: Written by and starring Jo Scanlan and Vicki Pepperdine, co-creators of the BAFTA nominated Getting On, _Puppy Love_ (qv) is a story of love, dogs and the love of dogs. Set around The Wirral-based dog training classes run by the formidable Nana V (Jo Scanlan) - "For All Your Dogging Needs". _Puppy Love_ (qv) follows two very different women - Nana V and Naomi Singh (Vicki Pepperdine) as they navigate their headstrong dogs, impossible teenage kids and disappointing husbands.::Anon.
